result.execSummary:
The defendant Randy A Onukwugha Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide a DNA sample; pay applicable surcharge. Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges by 09-02-16 or, if not paid, serve 20 days in HOC.

COURT WILL GRANT EXPUNCTION IF PROOF OF ALL COSTS PAID I FULL AND ALL ORDERS OF SENTENCE ARE COMPLETED.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence; Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work. Defendant to report for sentence on 09-09-15.

- Court does not object to sentence being transferred to Ozaukee County.
Defendant will not receive gun back.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randy A Onukwugha Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
F&C Commitment issued for failure to pay as ordered.
20 days HOC.
DUE & OWING.

AS TO COUNT 1
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 3 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 3 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work. Defendant to report for sentence on 9/9/2015.

*Court does not object to sentence being transferred to Ozaukee COunty. 

Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and pay applicable surcharge. 

Court ordered defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges by 9/2/2016 or, if not paid, serve 20 days in the House of Correction.

Defendant will not receive gun back. 

Court will grant expunction if proof of all costs paid in full and all orders of sentence are completed. 

Filed, 
Sentencing Referral Form, Notice of RIght to Seek Postconviction Relief, and Pretrial Incarceration Form.

Defendant Randy A Onukwugha in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties have reached a resolution. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire, Addendum, and Elements received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

AS TO COUNT 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the state, court ordered count 2 Dismissed, But Read In.

Defendant Randy A Onukwugha in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-02-2015 at 08:30 am.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Randy A Onukwugha in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Randy A Onukwugha in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
